question: Don't you have enough sense not to bother people when they're sleeping?
answer: Wake up!

question: Wake up? Saturday is the lone day I get to sleep late.
answer: It's gonna be hot today.

question: Good! Leave me alone when I'm sleeping. I'm gonna get a lock on my door, to keep ya ass outta here.
answer: Don't ya love ya brother Mookie anymore? I loves ya, Jade.

question: Do me a favor. Go to work.
answer: Later. Gotta get paid.

question: Good morning, Mookie.
answer: Good morning to you.

question: Now, Mookie, don't work too hard today. The man said it's gonna be HOT as the devil. I don't want ya falling out from the heat. You hear me, son?
answer: I hear ya, Mother Sister. I hear you.

question: Shaddup, Vito.
answer: Fuck dat shit. I deliver pizzas. That's what I get paid for.

question: You get paid to do what we say.
answer: What we say. I didn't hear Sal say nuthin'.

question: What's keeping him?
answer: You call him, then.

question: Yo, Ahmad!
answer: I coulda done dat.

question: Yo, Ahmad! Punchy, if ya want to do some more screaming, be my guest. I'm too through.
answer: Who's yelling my name?

question: Punchy told me to.
answer: Don't listen to him, it will get ya in trouble.

question: Heard that, Punchy.
answer: Ella, you have a brain, use it.

question: Where's the Bud? Where's the Bud?
answer: No mo' Bud. You look what we have and buy.

question: No more Bud. What kind of joint is this? How come no mo' Bud? Doctor, this ain't Korea, China, or wherever you come from. Get some Budweiser in this motherfucker.
answer: You buy 'nother beer.

question: Alright. Alright. Y'know you're asking a lot to make a man change his beer, that's asking a lot, Doctor.
answer: You ole drunk. What did I tell ya about drinking in front of my stoop? Move on, you're blocking my view. You ugly enough. Don't stare at me. The evil eye doesn't work on me.

question: Mother Sister, you've been talkin' 'bout me the last eighteen years. What have I ever done to you?
answer: You're a drunk fool.

question: Besides that. Da Mayor don't bother nobody. Nobody don't bother Da Mayor but you. Da Mayor just mind his business. I love everybody. I even love you.
answer: Hold your tongue. You don't have that much love.

question: Don't worry about it. But when it happens and I'm in my boat and ya black ass is drowning, don't ask me to throw you a lifesaver either.
answer: Fool, you're thirty cents away from a quarter. How you gonna get a boat?

question: Don't worry about it.
answer: You're raggedy as a roach. You eat the holes out of donuts.

question: I'll be back on my feet. Soon enough.
answer: So when is all this ice suppose to melt?

question: You paying now or on layaway?
answer: How much?

question: You come in here at least three times a day. You a retard? A buck fifty.
answer: Damn, Sal, put some more cheese on that motherfucker.

question: Extra cheese is two dollars. Y'know dat.
answer: Two dollars! Forget it! Mookie.

question: Two dollars! Forget it! Mookie.
answer: What?

question: How come you ain't got no brothers up?
answer: Ask Sal.

question: Mookie.
answer: Gotta go.

question: C'mere, Doctor. Doctor, this is Da Mayor talkin'. Doctor, always try to do the right thing.
answer: That's it?

question: That's it.
answer: I got it.

question: I got it.
answer: He bends down to pick up the pizza box and tackles the last few flights.

question: No, it's not cold. Twelve dollars for the pie. Hold it. Let me count this first. You're short. Twelve is right, but no tip. Look, lady. I carried your pizza up five flights of stairs and shit. The cheese didn't slide over to one side like it sometimes does with delivery people who don't care. I do care. May I get paid? I'll wait.
answer: Mookie bends down to tie his sneakers.

question: Jade, you're late.
answer: I know, Mother Sister, but I'm here now. Where's the stuff?

question: Seen your brother, just walked by.
answer: This might take some time.

question: I got nowhere to go. We haven't had a good sit-down for a long while. Tender-headed runs in my family. You tender-headed?
answer: Yeah, me too.

question: That's why I don't fool with it. Only let you touch it...Ouch!
answer: Sorry, comb got caught.

question: Be gentle, child. Mother Sister is an old woman.
answer: How are you holding up in this weather?

question: I'll do.
answer: I don't know why you still haven't bought an air conditioner.

question: You are too cruel to Da Mayor, it isn't right.
answer: I'm not studying no Mayor. Besides, he reminds me of my least favorite peoples. My tenants and my ex- husband--Goddamn-bless his soul. Number One

question: And move to Long Island...
answer: And move to Long Island. Number Two

question: Where are they? What kind of fucking asshole question is that? They ran the fuck away.
answer: Do you wish to file a complaint?

question: A complaint. I want those fucks locked under the jail.
answer: This hydrant better not come back on or there's gonna be hell to pay.

question: Mister Seor Love Daddy is cool.
answer: Ya like him, huh?

question: Yeah.
answer: Y'know, Vito, I know Pino is ya brother and shit, but the next time he hits ya, the next time he touches ya, you should "house him." Kick his ass.

question: I don't know.
answer: If you don't make a stand, he's gonna be beating ya like a egg for the rest of your life.

question: That's what you think?
answer: That's what I think.

question: I don't like to fight.
answer: Do it this one time and he'll never touch you again. Mister Seor Love Daddy, I'd like to dedicate the next record to my heart, Tina. That's right on time. This is my friend, Vito. His pops is Sal.

question: I'll do that.
answer: We're outta here.

question: You the man.
answer: You the man.

question: No, you the man.
answer: No. I'm just a struggling Black man trying to keep my dick hard in a cruel and harsh world.

question: Vito is down.
answer: Yo! Yo!

question: Yo! Yo!
answer: Yes?

question: You almost knocked me down. The word is "excuse me."
answer: Excuse me. I'm very sorry.

question: Not only did you knock me down, you stepped on my new white Air Jordans that I just bought and that's all you can say, "Excuse me?" I'll fuck you up quick two times. Who told you to step on my sneakers? Who told you to walk on my side of the block? Who told you to be in my neighborhood?
answer: I own a brownstone on this block.

question: Who told you to buy a brownstone on my block, in my neighborhood on my side of the street? What do you want to live in a Black neighborhood for? Motherfuck gentrification.
answer: I'm under the assumption that this is a free country and one can live where he pleases.

question: It's a fucking shame.
answer: What is?

question: Sweet Dick Willie.
answer: That's my name.

question: OK, but listen up. I'm gonna break it down.
answer: Let it be broke.

question: Can ya dig it?
answer: It's dug.

question: Sonny! Sonny! Doctor, what's your name?
answer: Eddie Lovell.

question: How old are you?
answer: Ten.

question: What makes Sammy run?
answer: My name is Eddie.

question: What makes Sammy run?
answer: I said my name is Eddie Lovell.

question: Relax, Eddie, I want you to go to the corner store. How much will it cost me?
answer: How would I know how much it's gonna cost if I don't know what I'm buying?

question: Eddie, you're too smart for your own britches. Listen to me. How much do you want to run to the store for Da Mayor?
answer: Fifty cents.

question: I know I haven't seen you in four days. I'm a working man.
answer: I work too, but I still make time.

question: Tina, what do you want me to do?
answer: I want you to spend some time with me. I want you to try and make this relationship work. If not, I'd rather not be bothered.

question: Alright. Alright. I'll be over there sometime today.
answer: When?

question: Before I get off work.
answer: Bring some ice cream, I'm burning up. Do you love me?

question: Who's your favorite basketball player?
answer: Magic Johnson.

question: And not Larry Bird? Who's your favorite movie star?
answer: Eddie Murphy.

question: Shut up. The Boss! Bruuucce!!!!
answer: Sounds funny to me. As much as you say nigger this and nigger that, all your favorite people are "niggers."

question: It's different. Magic, Eddie, Prince are not niggers, I mean, are not Black. I mean, they're Black but not really Black. They're more than Black. It's different.
answer: Pino, I think secretly that you wish you were Black. That's what I think. Vito, what do you say?

question: Y'know, I've been listening and reading 'bout Farrakhan, ya didn't know that, did you?
answer: I didn't know you could read.

question: Fuck you. Anyway, Minister Farrakhan always talks about the so-called "day" when the Black man will rise. "We will one day rule the earth as we did in our glorious past." You really believe that shit?
answer: It's e-vit-able.

question: Keep dreaming.
answer: Fuck you, fuck pizza, and fuck Frank Sinatra, too.

question: Well, fuck you, too, and fuck Michael Jordan.
answer: Dago, wop, garlic-breath, guinea, pizza-slinging, spaghetti-bending, Vic Damone, Perry Como, Luciano Pavarotti, Sole Mio, nonsinging motherfucker.

question: Sal, can you do me a favor?
answer: Depends.

question: Can you pay me now?
answer: Can't do.

question: Sal, just this once, do me that solid.
answer: You know you don't get paid till we close tonight. We're still open.

question: I would like to get paid now.
answer: Tonight, when we close.

question: Whaddup. Money?
answer: I was going to buy a slice.

question: I'll be back after I make this delivery.
answer: On the rebound.

question: That's the dope.
answer: I just copped them. Let me tell you the story of Right-Hand--Left- Hand--the tale of Good and Evil.

question: I'm listening.
answer: HATE! It was with this hand that Brother Cain iced his brother. LOVE! See these fingers, they lead straight to the soul of man. The right hand. The hand of LOVE! The story of Life is this... STATIC! One hand is always fighting the other. Left Hand Hate is kicking much ass and it looks like Right Hand Love is finished. Hold up. Stop the presses! Love is coming back, yes, it's Love. Love has won. Left Hand Hate KO'ed by Love. Brother, Mookie, if I love you I love you, but if I hate you...

question: I understand.
answer: I love you, my brother.

question: I love you, Black.
answer: Two slices.

question: Thanks. Jade.
answer: I'm in here. How come you're not at Sal's?

question: I'm working.
answer: Is this another one of your patented two-hour lunches?

question: I just come home to take a quick shower.
answer: Sal's gonna be mad.

question: Later for Sal. Y'know, sometimes I think you're more concerned with him than me.
answer: I think no such a thing. Sal pays you, you should work.

question: Slavery days are over. My name ain't Kunta Kinte. Sis, I don't want to argue, stop pressing me.
answer: I just don't want you to lose the one job you've been able to keep, that's all. I'm carrying you as it is.

question: Don't worry 'bout me. I always get paid.
answer: Yeah, then ya should take better care of your responsibilities.

question: What responsibilities?
answer: I didn't stutter. Take care of your responsibilities. Y'know exactly what I'm talking about.

question: I'm beat.
answer: Pop, I think we should sell this place, get outta here while we're still ahead...and alive.

question: Since when do you know what's best for us?
answer: Couldn't we sell this and open up a new one in our own neighborhood?

question: Too many pizzerias already there.
answer: Then we could try something else.

question: We don't know nuthin' else.
answer: I'm sick of niggers, it's a bad neighborhood. I don't like being around them, they're animals.

question: That's not even true. I just want a slice.
answer: Jade, you don't know this, but I'm organizing a boycott of Sal's Famous Pizzeria.

question: What did he do this time?
answer: Y'know all those pictures he has hanging on the Wall of Fame?

question: So?
answer: Have you noticed something about them?

question: I'll see ya there.
answer: Peace. Every single one of those pictures is somebody Italian.

question: And?
answer: And I--we--want some Black people up.

question: Did you ask Sal?
answer: Yeah, I asked him. I don't want nobody in there, nobody spending good money in Sal's. He should get no mo' money from the community till he puts some Black faces up on that motherfucking wall.

question: Buggin' Out, I don't mean to be disrespectful, but you can really direct your energies in a more useful way.
answer: So, in other words, you are not down.

question: I'm down, but for a worthwhile cause.
answer: Jade, I still love you.

question: You still letting Pino push you around?
answer: Who told you that? He doesn't push me, who told you, Mookie tell you that? I hold my own.

question: Forget about it, Vito. Forget I even brought it up.
answer: Pino picks on me, but I don't let him push me around. Mookie tell you that?

question: Twenty "D" Duracells.
answer: Twenty "C" Duracells.

question: D, not C.
answer: C Duracell.

question: D! D! D! You dumb motherfucker. Learn how to speak English first. D.
answer: How many you say?

question: Twenty! Motherfucker! Twenty!
answer: Motherfucker you.

question: ML?
answer: What?

question: ML, hold this for me.
answer: That's OK. At least my moms didn't name me Sweet Dick Willie.

question: Why you gotta talk 'bout my moms?
answer: Nobody talkin' 'bout ya moms.

question: I didn't say nobody, I said you.
answer: Sweet Dick, I didn't mean it like that.

question: You should be ashamed of yourself.
answer: Ma'am, the boy is just scared to death. What actually happened is that I was minding my business when I saw your son about to be run over. I ran into the street to save him and I had to knock him down to keep the both of us from getting hit.

question: Eddie, is that the truth? Eddie, you hear me talkin' to you? I'm talkin' to you, boy.
answer: Miss, the boy is fine.

question: Jade, I don't want you coming in here no mo'.
answer: Stop tripping.

question: No, you're tripping. Don't come in Sal's. Alright, read my lips.
answer: What are you so worked up about?

question: Over Sal, the way he talks and the way he looks at you.
answer: He's just being nice.

question: Nice!
answer: He's completely innocent.

question: Innocent!
answer: I didn't stutter. You heard me.

question: You should see the way he looks at you. All Sal wants to do is hide the salami.
answer: You are too crude.

question: I might be, but you're not welcome here.
answer: Stop trying to play big brother. I'm a grown woman. You gotta lotta nerve. Mookie, you can hardly pay your rent and you're gonna tell me what to do. Come off it.

question: One has nuthin' to do with the other.
answer: Oh, it doesn't, huh! You got your little 250 dollars a week plus tips...

question: I'm getting paid...
answer: ...peanuts.

question: Pretty soon I'll be making a move.
answer: I truly hope so. I'm tired of supporting a grown man.

question: That was a foolish act, but it was brave. That chile owes you his life.
answer: I wasn't trying to be a hero. I saw what was about to happen and I reacted, didn't even think. If I did, I might not have done it in second thought. Da Mayor is an old man, haven't run that fast in years. I went from first to home on a bunt single, scored the winning run, the bottom of the ninth, two out, August 1, 1939, Snow Hill, Alabama. Maybe I should be heroic more often.

question: Maybe you shouldn't. Don't get happy. This changes nothing between you and me. You did a good thing and Mother Sister wanted to thank you for it.
answer: I thank you.

question: Sal, I don't care if you fire me this exact minute, leave my sister alone.
answer: Mookie, I don't know what you're talking about, plus I don't want to hear it.

question: Sal, just do me a favor, leave Jade alone.
answer: Here, you gotta delivery.

question: Is this the right name and address?
answer: Yeah, do you know 'em?

question: No, just checking. Delivery from Sal's Famous Pizzeria.
answer: What took you so long? Is it hot?

question: Hot. Hot.
answer: Come in then.

question: Tina, you are too slick.
answer: How else was I going to get you here? I haven't seen you in a week.

question: I've been working hard, getting paid.
answer: Where's the ice cream? The Hagen- Dazs butter pecan?

question: Shit! I forgot.
answer: Your memory is really getting bad.

question: I just forgot.
answer: And I really wanted some ice cream too.

question: I can run out and get it.
answer: No! No! You won't come back either.

question: I can't be staying long anyway.
answer: How long then?

question: Long enough for us to do the nasty.
answer: That's out. No! It's too hot! You think I'm gonna let you get some, put on your clothes, then run outta here and never see you again in who knows when?

question: A quickie is good every once in a blue moon.
answer: You a blue-moon fool.

question: Then we'll do something else.
answer: What else?

question: Trust me.
answer: Trust you? Because of trusting you we have a son. Remember your son?

question: Trust me. I'm gonna take off ya clothes.
answer: Mookie, I told you already it's too fucking hot to make love.

question: Why you gotta curse?
answer: I'm sorry, but no rawness is jumping off tonight.

question: No rawness. Tina, you're sweating.
answer: Of course I'm sweating. I'm burning up. It's hot, moron, only a hundred degrees in here.

question: It's cold.
answer: It's 'pose to be cold.

question: Later for you.
answer: Meda. Meda.

question: What?
answer: Tina, you don't have a forehead, you got a eight-head. Thank God for thighs. Thank God for buttocks. Thank God for the right nipple... Thank God for the left nipple...

question: Feels good.
answer: Yes, yes, Lord. Isn't this better than Haagen-Dazs butter pecan ice cream? I'll be back tonight.

question: Ten. Here you go.
answer: What do we owe you?

question: Nine-fifty.
answer: Here.

question: Sal, if you want me to deliver any faster, get me a jet rocket or something, cuz I can't run with pizzas, all the cheese ends up on one side and shit.
answer: I didn't say nuthin'. You must have a guilty conscience. What are you guilty of?

question: I'm not guilty of nuthin'.
answer: You must be guilty of something or you would have never come in saying the things you said.

question: C'mon, Sal.
answer: Where we goin'?

question: Vito, I want you to listen to me. I'm your brother. I may smack you around once in awhile, boss you around, but I'm still your brother.
answer: I know this.

question: I love you.
answer: I'm listening.

question: Good. I want you to listen.
answer: Jesus Christ on the cross, I said I'm listening.

question: Good. Vito, you trust that Mook too much. So does Pop.
answer: Mookie's OK.

question: You listening to me?
answer: Stop busting my balls. I said I'm listening ten fucking times already.

question: Mookie is not to be trusted. No Moulan Yan can be trusted. The first time you turn your back, boom, a knife right here. In the back.
answer: How do you know this?

question: I know.
answer: You really think so?

question: I know so. He, them, they're not to be trusted.
answer: So what do you want me to do?

question: Be on guard. Mookie has Pop conned already, so we have to look out for him.
answer: I like Mookie a lot.

question: How you be?
answer: I be. I'm living large.

question: Is that the only tape you got?
answer: You don't like Public Enemy? It's the dope shit.

question: I like 'em, but you don't play anything else.
answer: I don't like anything else.

question: Check this out. Y'know Sal's.
answer: Yeah, I know dat motherfucker.

question: I'm trying to organize a boycott of Sal's pizza joint. Ya see what I'm saying?
answer: I almost had to yoke him this afternoon. Tell me, tell me, Radio Raheem, to turn my music down. Didn't even say please. Who the fuck he think he is? Don Corleone and shit.

question: He makes all his money off us Black people and I don't see nuthin' but Italians all up in there, Sylvester Stallone and motherfuckers. Ya see what I'm saying, homeboy?
answer: Talk to me.

question: We shouldn't buy a single slice, spend a single penny in that motherfucker till some people of color are put up in there.
answer: That's what I'm talkin' 'bout. That's what I'm talkin' 'bout.

question: You got my back.
answer: Ya back is got.

question: My brother.
answer: My brother.

question: What did I tell ya 'bout dat noise?
answer: What did I tell ya 'bout dem pictures?

question: What da fuck! Are you deaf?
answer: No, are you? We want some Black people up on the Wall of Fame.

question: Turn that JUNGLE MUSIC off. We ain't in Africa.
answer: Why it gotta be about jungle music and Africa?

question: Fuck! My money!
answer: Where are you going?

question: To get my money.
answer: Mookie, you must think I'm stupid or something. You're gonna run outta here and I won't see your black ass for another week.

question: Tina, it's not like that.
answer: You don't care about me and you definately don't care 'bout your son.

question: Tina, I'll be right back.
answer: Be a man.

question: I am a man.
answer: Act like one then. Be a man.

question: Later.
answer: You're to the curb. You better step off. Get a life.

question: Good morning.
answer: Is it a good morning?

question: Yes indeed. You almost got yourself killed last night.
answer: I've done that before. Where did you sleep?

question: I didn't.
answer: I hope the block is still standing.
